words.definition: If someone is bankrupt, they do not have enough money to pay their debts.
words.example: The company went bankrupt and had to close.

words.definition: To conform means to follow the rules or customs of a group.
words.example: Students are expected to conform to the school's rules.

words.definition: To employ someone means to pay them to work for you.
words.example: The factory employs over five hundred workers.

words.definition: To expel someone means to force them to leave a place or organization.
words.example: He was expelled from school for fighting.

words.definition: An extension is an extra part added to something to make it longer.
words.example: They are building an extension to their house.

words.definition: If something is forthcoming, it is about to happen in the near future.
words.example: We are looking forward to the forthcoming holiday.

words.definition: To furnish a room means to put furniture in it.
words.example: They furnished the living room with a new sofa and chairs.

words.definition: Hygiene is the practice of keeping yourself and your surroundings clean.
words.example: Good personal hygiene is important for staying healthy.

words.definition: When something is hygienic, it is clean and unlikely to cause disease.
words.example: It is important to keep the kitchen in a hygienic condition.

words.definition: A landlord is a person who owns a building and rents it to others.
words.example: The landlord collected the rent at the beginning of the month.

words.definition: To lease something means to use it for a period of time in exchange for money.
words.example: They decided to lease a car instead of buying one.

words.definition: If something is mandatory, it is required by law or a rule.
words.example: It is mandatory to wear a seatbelt in the car.

words.definition: To mend something means to fix it when it is broken or damaged.
words.example: He mended the hole in his socks.

words.definition: A mortgage is a loan from a bank to buy a house.
words.example: They took out a mortgage to buy their first home.

words.definition: Personnel are the people who work for an organization.
words.example: The company's personnel department handles all hiring.

words.definition: Plumbing is the system of pipes and fixtures in a building.
words.example: The plumbing in the old house needs to be replaced.

words.definition: A tenant is a person who rents a building or land from a landlord.
words.example: The tenant paid the rent on time every month.

words.definition: If something is trendy, it is fashionable and popular.
words.example: She likes to wear trendy clothes.

words.definition: Utility is the quality of being useful.
words.example: The utility of the new tool was immediately apparent.

words.definition: Whereby means by which or through which.
words.example: They developed a system whereby customers can order online.
